attributes.action: Make it compulsory for councils to have zebra crossings outside every school
attributes.background: Road Safety around children should be compulsory and precautions outside every school regardless of incidents. If there’s children crossing we need to keep them safe at all costs.
attributes.additional_details: I think that not enough is done for road safety of our children. Lollipop ladies don’t seem to exist anymore and where we are in a rural town road safety isn’t consider necessary by Kent County Council they insist on a number of incidents occurring or a fatality. It shouldn’t take something to happen for precautions to be in place. There should be a zebra crossing outside every school!

attributes.action: Make ‘Settled Application’ free for EU citizens
attributes.background:
There are about 2.9 million EU citizens living in the UK, the majority of whom came to the UK in good faith and are hard working taxpayers. 

We feel it a stab in the back to make them pay for acquiring 'settled' status. Why should they be the victims of brexit, when they had no say in the matter?

attributes.action: 6 points on the persons driving licence if caught leaving a dog in a hot car
attributes.background: People who leave their dogs in baking hot cars should be disciplined with 6 points on their driving licence and reported directly to the RSPCA.

attributes.action: Withdraw the sovereignty of the U.S embassy & send the U.S ambassadors home
attributes.background: In light of the atrocities carried out by Donald Trump's administration in the name of "strong borders" we must not tolerate the human rights abuses carried out against migrant children and their families, it is clear we must cut all ties with America.
attributes.additional_details:
Here is evidence of the crimes against immigrants held in detention centres.
https://www.thecut.com/2018/06/immigrant-children-detention-center-separated-parents.html
https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/us-politics/us-immigration-children-audio-trump-border-patrol-separate-families-parents-detention-center-a8405501.html
https://www.thecut.com/2018/06/immigrant-children-allegedly-drugged-abused-in-shelters.html
What is happening to these children and their families is abhorrent.

attributes.action: Fine parents who refuse to have regular contact with their children.
attributes.background: Parents who choose not see their children regularly subject them to feelings of abandonment. More action and strict policies should be in place to enforce regular contact. Where possible, children need their both parents.

attributes.action: Make public stadiums and arenas ban or charge for single use plastic cups.
attributes.background: Make all stadiums, public arenas and any venue using plastic cups/bottles either ban the use of these and use a paper alternative or have a deposit scheme where a charge is applied for anyone using a plastic cup/bottle and is refunded when the cup/bottle is returned.
attributes.additional_details:
Plastic takes between 500-1000 years to degrade.

50% of sea turtles have consumed plastic.

1,000,000 sea birds and 100,000 marine animals are killed each year due to plastic waste.

There is more micro-plastic in the sea then stars in the Milky Way.

Single use bags, Straws, cups and bottle are the most common type of plastic pollution found in the ocean.

All the plastic that has ever been made is still around in one shape or another (excluding that which has been incinerated)

attributes.action: FREE sanitary products for women with endometriosis
attributes.background: 1 in 10 women of reproductive age in the UK suffer from endometriosis. 10% of women world wide have endometriosis - that's 176 million worldwide. Women with endometriosis usually experience extremely heavy and painful periods and can go through as many as 20 night time pads in an average day.

attributes.action: The country needs more Social Housing
attributes.background: In London the average waiting time for Social Housing is 10 years. For families that are in financial difficulties, this is a long wait. They will be moved around areas,moving from one temporary property to another. To fix this issue we need more Social housing across the country.
attributes.additional_details: According to The Guardian: The idea of affordable housing has been 'twisted and out of shape'

attributes.action: Do not remain in the EEA
attributes.background:
Remaining in the EEA will stop the UK becoming the sovereign nation that was voted for in the referendum.
All the promises of new trade deals will become token at best.
Nations outside of the EU has warned against staying in the EU like this and we demand parliament does as was told by the people.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theaustralian.com.au/national-affairs/alexander-downer-warns-uk-of-irrelevancy-over-soft-brexit-plans/news-story/c967595695165c994395d81fbb91e100

attributes.action: Make 8th May 'Attenborough Day' - a bank holiday for visiting nature.
attributes.background: Sir David Attenborough is one of the greatest Britons of the past 100 years. Rather than putting him on a plastic bank note or a commemorative coin, mark his Birthday with a public holiday for getting into nature and cleaning up our environment.
attributes.additional_details: Doing good things, especially outside, makes people happier. Happier people make happier workers means greater production. It’s a win win.

attributes.action: If a person uses a vehicle as a weapon they should receive a lifetime ban
attributes.background: If a person gets into a vehicle and ultimately uses that vehicle as a weapon then they should get an automatic lifetime ban from driving on top of any convictions that the courts see fit to administer.
attributes.additional_details:
It is quickly becoming a new trend for people to jump into a vehicle and drive it into a crowd, this is a problem on several fronts including terrorism. 

The courts deal with the criminal aspect by handing out custodial sentences, however when the convicted party leaves prison they are allowed to reapply for a licence or continue driving as the bans handed out are normally spent whilst in prison.

If these offenders were convicted of Animal Cruelty they would receive a lifetime ban.

attributes.action: Debate the impact of Trump's visit on the UK's security and reputation
attributes.background: Since moving into the White House, Mr Trump has shown an impatience bordering on intolerance toward peaceful protests, the media and even the democratic process itself. So his visit to Britain will be an important opportunity to underline the importance of free speech and the right to protest.

attributes.action: Ban Mobile Phones on School Grounds
attributes.background: Our children are struggling at school. They are distracted by the thrill of social media via their mobile device. This must stop so why allow them to take the device onto school grounds?  If they have a problem at school, or we need to contact them urgently, we should go via the school office.
attributes.additional_details:
Not allowing them to take their devices to school would promote their conversational skills (they would be forced to talk to one another), allow them to focus more on their lessons, stop contact with parents during the day (we are busy with work and do not need the worry) and reduce online bullying.

It’s about time the UK Government woke up to this epidemic of device use at school and started to realise what effect it is having on the working force of tomorrow.  Let’s do something now!

attributes.action: Introduce a South African Vulnerable Persons' Resettlement Programme
attributes.background:
- 1,700 people have been killed in farm attacks in two decades 
- In 2016/17 torture was used in 17.6% of murders 
- the South African Parliament decided in Feb to approve a motion in favour of “the expropriation of [white-owned] land without compensation”.
attributes.additional_details:
- In 2014 Britain established the Syrian Vulnerable Person Resettlement Programme (VPRP). Since June 2017 all those admitted to the UK under the VPRP have been granted refugee status. 
- We therefore merely call for equal treatment by the British government for South Africa.”

attributes.action: OFSTED to closely monitor training qualifications provided by care organisations
attributes.background: All care companies should have, their training programmes Ofsted inspected, and assessors to hold the minimum of a teaching degree.
attributes.additional_details: Currently care companies, self regulate their in house training programmes. This leaves their training programmes wide open not only to educational fraud, but also the substandard delivery and assessment of  in-house training programmes. Each in-house training programme should also lead to a nationally recognised qualification. Which should be standardised internally and externally.

attributes.action: Do not impose same-sex marriage on religious minorities
attributes.background: We call on Parliament, now and in the future, to continue to uphold the fundamental human right of religious minorities (Christians, Muslims, Jews and others) not to have same-sex marriage imposed on us, as guaranteed by the so-called ‘quadruple lock’ in the Marriage (Same Sex Couples) Act 2013.
attributes.additional_details:
The right of religious minorities not to have same-sex marriage imposed on them was guaranteed by the so-called ‘quadruple lock’ which was included in the Marriage (Same Sex Couples) Act 2013 when same-sex marriage was legalized in the UK.

We call on Parliament to continue to uphold and respect this fundamental human right.

We remind Parliament that one of its key functions in a democratic society is to protect minorities from the ‘tyranny of the majority.’

attributes.action: Let the public ask for animal abusers to have unduly lenient sentences reviewed.
attributes.background: Animal abuse is currently not one of the crimes for which members of the public can ask for unduly lenient sentences to be reviewed.  This needs to change urgently.

attributes.action: Give parents paid leave for school closure/sickness for their children
attributes.background: I find it ever so unfair when you work hard to support your children, children are far more likely to pick up bugs and illnesses, parent should not have to lose pay or take holiday to cover the time off to look their child it should paid by the employer
attributes.additional_details: My daughter was recently admitted into hospital, she was there for a week, I had to take it as holiday because i would lose a lot of money if I took it as sick.... firstly I’m not sick and secondly it’s not a holiday, I should be entitled to get paid time off for my child care, but it must be proven time off obviously, I however took it as holiday as I had no choice, this I feel is unfair as you should no be punished for a child sickness, I would work if I was ill, but children are different

attributes.action: Impose sanctions on America until they change their laws regarding firearms
attributes.background: Since the start of 2018, 18 school shootings have occurred in the USA - averaging to three every week. This is as much a gun control issue as it is a mental health issue. We call upon the government to impose some sanctions upon the US until they DO something to control this devastating situation.

attributes.action: Form a public holiday to celebrate our NHS; incl. all in the emergency services
attributes.background:
The NHS is one of our key British Values.

A NHS Day holiday in the summer would serve to underscore our deep admiration for all of those who work in the health and emergency services. With events celebrating its formation, those that serve and events to promote health and community.
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS is, if anything, one of our key British Values. Given this, is it not time to truly celebrate the NHS!?!?
This would allow a focus of public opinion and need for such a critical part of who we are as a nation, showing the world that this is who we are and what we hold dearest to our hearts. If ever there was a time to show how strong we all feel about the NHS it's now. What better way to do that than a public holiday focused around celebrating this bedrock of our society!

attributes.action: Build a bypass from Sellafield to Barrow in furness
attributes.background: As a very frequent user of the A595 to Barrow in furness like many others I believe the road is inadequate, it is very dangerous and even more so when the weather is bad. Which is extremely often.  I believe that it would be in people's best interest to create a much safer road.
attributes.additional_details:
Teenager airlifted to hospital and man arrested as A595 is closed near Bootle - Sep 2017
A595 blocked by crash - June 2007
Driver to appear in Barrow court after crash on the A595 at Bootle - Sep 2017
These are but a few. I have a whole research file on this. 
There are also many many crashes and closures due to weather. The main causes; snow, ice, rain and fog. People need to use these roads daily. It would be much safer to have a bigger more straight road. Think of the lives that can be saved.

attributes.action: law to put panic buttons in hgv s incase drivers have medical emergency
attributes.background: Lots of drivers going missing and when found are deceased in their cabs, either unable to raise alarm of feeling unwell or no signal on phone etc

attributes.action: Create a Dedicated Minister for Dogs (and cats)
attributes.background:
49% of UK adults own a pet. 25% of the UK adult have a cat with an estimated population of 11.1 million pet cats. 24% of the UK adult population have a dog with an estimated population of 8.9 million pet dogs.
The cost of keeping a dog each year varies by breed size £750 - £5,000
attributes.additional_details: Many services for the dog industry are not officially regulated or regulated enough. The laws are outdated, and have no consequences, yet many dogs suffer, and owners have no support if their dogs are harmed or stolen. There are various bodies and charities but each stands alone. Sweden has many forward thinking ideas which could be followed. Pet owners are often frustrated by having no voice!

attributes.action: Make animal welfare part of the schools curriculum.
attributes.background: Cruelty to animals is sadly a very common occurrence in the UK. Some is deliberate and some born out of ignorance. Respect, compassion and understanding for all animals is most important if we are to make any positive progress as a society.
attributes.additional_details:
It is appropriate to teach animal welfare in schools as many jobs and careers involve working with animals. We should have an understanding of what is involved in the farming of livestock, what actually takes place in a slaughterhouse and the fact that eating animals is not a necessity. 
Children should be made aware of the environmental impact of factory farming and large scale fishing. Facts regarding human nutritional requirements, exactly where and how animal products are obtained and our personal responsibility for all forms of life on earth needs to be studied.

attributes.action: Change the laws on buying and selling property in England and Wales
attributes.background: The government urgently need to review the laws relating to buying and selling property.Buying or selling a property is one of the most stressful experiences of any adults life.
attributes.additional_details: The current system is open to absolute abuse and gives neither the buyer or seller any security or confidence that the transaction will be completed.Should one part of the housing chain collapse, many individuals and families are caused massive distress,anxiety and financial loss.It isn't difficult to change the laws to those they follow in Scotland.This is the 21st century.The laws need to be changed now.As far as I can see the only reason changes haven't been made is because the lawyers don't want it changed.If the property sale falls through, they still get paid.

attributes.action: Introduce yearly mental health checks on the NHS
attributes.background: With how society is nowadays, it is very easy to find yourself struggling. An annual mental health check will give everyone a chance to talk about their feelings to a trained professional who will be able to react to this in a more proactive way than a friend who may not know how to deal with it.
attributes.additional_details: Suicide is now at its all time highest, with it being the most common cause of death for men aged 20-49 across England and Wales. More and more pressures have emerged that we as humans were not originally designed to deal with such as financial worries, the rise of social media and having demanding jobs so there is no wonder 1 in 15 of us have made a suicide attempt at some point in our lives.

attributes.action: Make an insurance on the car itself instead of the individuals who drive it
attributes.background: The insurance in many countries like Portugal, Poland or America is made on car itself instead of individuals who drive it. This would make it easier for everyone as people will be able to drive the car even if they are not its owner and will not pay huge amounts for borrowing it.
attributes.additional_details:
In the Portugal the road traffic fatalities are decreasing with each year as young people can learn to drive with their parents car. In the 2010, there was 937 road traffic fatalities and through 5 years it has decreased to 593.
Making this change in the country will allow people to save more money on the insurances and will allow young people to drive and learn on their parents car without buying separate insurance, which can cost a lot.

attributes.action: Male Suicide Prevention Strategy
attributes.background: According to the ONS, "of the 5,965 suicides registered in 2016, a total of 4,508 were male and 1,457 were female." We call on HM Government to take urgent and meaningful action to identify main factors that contribute to men in the UK being three times more likely to commit suicide than women.
attributes.additional_details:
We call on the PM to establish a panel on Male Suicide Prevention, whose job would be to undertake public consultation and produce a comprehensive report on male suicide in the UK; with key findings and recommendations leading to the publication of the Government's first ever UK-wide Male Suicide Prevention Strategy.

"The fall in suicide rates from 2015 to 2016 is the largest decrease in 20 years. It fell for both males and females in the UK, although men still account for 3/4 of all suicides."

attributes.action: Re-think the current legislation criminalising cannabis.
attributes.background: The governments response to a similar petition stated that they are basing policy on a 10 year old report done under labour, I'm asking the government to re-think this policy by conducting a new, up to date and relevant study to bring our legislation up to modern standards.

attributes.action: Mandatory 5 year prison sentence for carrying a knife on the first offence
attributes.background: The streets of the United Kingdom have been lost to knife wielding thugs who suffer  little or no consequence for their actions. Social media and local news is awash with videos and images of knives on our streets. The two strike rule has failed. A mandatory 5 year sentence must be enforced for all.

attributes.action: Make childcare free from one year old
attributes.background: Childcare at the moment is only free from two if you have special circumstances, all other children have to wait til 3. If childcare was free from a year old a lot more parents would have the oppurtunity work or work more hours that cant currently because of the price of childcare.
attributes.additional_details: At the moment for a child under three years old to attend a full day of nursery the average price is around £50 a day. Family's who are living on lower incomes  can't afford this and many are reducing their hours or giving up work completely as the money they are spending can be as much as or nearly as much as they are earning.

attributes.action: Legalise the use of Pyrotechnics at UK football grounds
attributes.background: The majority of countries within Europe and South America allow fans to use pyrotechnics such as smoke bombs and flares at football matches however current law states that in UK they are not allowed and the use of them can lead to stadium bans as well as custodial sentences.
attributes.additional_details: Football banning orders for use of pyrotechnics are at minimum 3 years through a court and can go up to 10 years. Even if you are caught with the smoke bomb in a bag search, the punishments can be just as harsh as if you had let it off.

attributes.action: An accepted offer on a house is a binding contract, withdrawal incurs 5% penalty
attributes.background: When we bought our house, the vendor withdrew at the last minute and selling our current house, more than one buyer withdrew at the last minute and in each case, leaving us with considerable inconvenience and unforeseen financial consequences. This will stop chains collapsing.

attributes.action: Review GB Domestic Driving hours.
attributes.background: 5.5 hours driving with a 30 minute break followed by another 4.5 hours driving is surely a health and safety issue. Bring it inline with EU Driving hours. 4.5 hours driving then a 45 minute break.

attributes.action: Amend Highway Code to include guidance for pothole avoidance
attributes.background: With the increasing number of unmarked dangerous defects in our road surfaces nationwide, there is no guidance in the Highway Code regarding a safe approach. Does one brake sharply, swerve, or proceed over the defect rendering your vehicle or motorcycle uncontrollable and potentially damaged?

attributes.action: Reduce Foreign Aid budget to 0.5% of GDP
attributes.background: I propose we reduce the Foreign Aid budget to 0.5% of GDP then put those savings into NHS, Policing, Armed Forces, Schools & Infra-structure in equal proportions.
attributes.additional_details:
We currently put 0.7% of our GDP into Foreign Aid, which is ok when we can afford it but the needs of our Country must come first.
It is the duty of the Government to put the security of the nation first that means increasing the funding for our Armed Forces.
It is also the duty of our Government to ensure the safety of its people that means increasing the funding for our Police.
Until our Road networks are repaired, our Hospitals upgraded, our schools rebuilt and our Police and Armed Forces are fully equipped to defend our Nation the reduce Foreign Aid Budget should remain.
Once we have rebuilt these vital services we can once again increase our Foreign Aid budget on the understanding that it is fully audited and overseen by our Armed Forces, that way we can see how our money is spent

attributes.action: Protect property sellers by introducing 'conclusion of missives' contracts
attributes.background: In Scotland you cannot back out of a house sale once 'missives are concluded', yet this is not the same in England. This will raise confidence for sellers and save any last minute dissapointments which costs the seller time, money, uncertainty and stress.
attributes.additional_details:
Recently I have had a buyer pull out of our sale 2 weeks before completion which, unless i can find a new buyer quickly, means we will lose the house we planned to buy, our deposit and all of the upfront fees we paid coming to almost £2000.
A lot of people have been in the same situation costing families thousands of pounds that they cannot afford to lose. If we introduce laws such as Scotlands, home sellers have more protection against buyers pulling out at the last minute with no repercussions

attributes.action: To debate the impact of not returning FULL control of our fisheries to the UK.
attributes.background: The decision to continue to allow EU fishing vessels access to UK  waters crosses political boundaries as the current EU policy is damaging our fish stocks and our fishing industry. It needs to be a Brexit negotiation red line as a plastic free ocean without fish is failure

attributes.action: Change the TV licensing law so that your TV licence covers you away from home.
attributes.background:
If you have a licence and travel on a bus whilst watching iPlayer you are covered. If you live or holiday in a caravan you are covered. 
If you stay in a hotel, B&B or holiday home you ARE NOT and require the owner of that establishment to have a licence.
attributes.additional_details:
You could be potentially breaking the law without even realising it.
I am one of those many law abiding citizens who have to work away from home due to lack of suitable work in my home area. I own a TV licence at home. During the week I rent a cottage off my employer. I have no utility bills, do not have the right to vote in this constituency and I am not registered with a GP here and yet I am required, by law, to have a TV licence - Why?
If you think that this should be changed please vote.

attributes.action: Amend the Dog Act to include taking DNA of every dog to be kept with Microchip.
attributes.background: This was first suggested in July 2016 following a mixed breed Staffie mixed type dog nearly killing my Border Terrier. Only 66 people at that time signed it, so this time round it should get a better result.
attributes.additional_details:
Due to the high number of dog attacks on sheep, and people as well as other canines, the aim is to have all dog owners and dog homes must have every dog’s DNA taken and registered on a database with their microchip. This would allow all dogs to be screened when attacks happen to find the owners.  Wounds can be swabbed and detection made, not only during injury investigation or th of sheep, but also for banned breeds!  
The DNA could also assist District Council to check samples of uncollected poo in order to trace owners and prosecute them.

attributes.action: Abolish section 58 highways act 1980
attributes.background: I dont think local councils should be able to use this act as a get out clause for not maintaining the roads to a higher standard.
attributes.additional_details: The roads are in a terrible state all over the country but councils are getting out of paying for the damage to all modes of transport on the roads due to this section 58 act. If they are unaware of the pot hole they cant fix it so its not their fault, thats great but if we let a payment slip or the likes of car insurance lapse we cant just say I never knew about it and be let off. Ignorance is not an excuse for us and should be the same for them do more thorough checks and sort out the roads.

attributes.action: Equality for men. Ban the use of urinals. Men should not be expected to use them
attributes.background: Women are able to urinate in private so why are men men expected to use urinals?  Yes, cubicles are also provided in most cases but they are typically being used by somebody that needs to do the alternative.  Men are under pressure to urinate next to another man despite the privacy concern.
attributes.additional_details: The smells that are emitted from the majority of urinals are awful. In addition, spare a thought for the cleaners. Also, banning the use of urinals would save an enormous quantity of water as the urinals typically flush automatically even when they are not being used. The time has come to provide equality for men and give us some privacy.

attributes.action: Amend class size legislation rule
attributes.background:
We lost our appeal to place our son in the closest school because of class size legislation 
His Dad is disabled and can't walk more than 200 metres and doesn't drive
The new school is 2 miles away so doesn't qualify for assistance there is no bus service or proper pavement
attributes.additional_details:
All relevant Doctors, Stroke Spealist and nuerologist reports were included and ignored His Disability award was provided 
The closet school mentioned it would make sense for our son to be allowed based on Dad's health. The rule was upheld above my child's safety and my husbands disability. 
Fundamentally this rule needs to be changed, forcing a disabled parent to travel further so his child can be educated is unacceptable if he can't get there. My child will walk 4 miles a day he is 5yrs old.

attributes.action: Ban Staples From Newspapers
attributes.background: Staples are an unnecessary addition to newspapers which are an environmental liability - this petition asks the government to ban the use of staples in newspaper production.
attributes.additional_details:
Staples are for the most part made using steel which is produced with the requirement of a blast furnace and this using large amounts of energy. No staples would also mean that newspapers would be more easily recyclable due to the absence of metal and the decay of newspapers would be much increased.
Banning staples would bring down production costs for newspaper companies And would create a safer environment in factories.

attributes.action: Use paper-based assessments for those DWP claimants who have been through abuse.
attributes.background: Abuse & Child Sexual Exploitation leaves a remaining scar on those who have been through the issue, meaning that talking about it can be extremely traumatic. It makes those who have been through CSE relive the events of that trauma, impacting not only their physical but mental health.
attributes.additional_details:
The current interview process is damaging for CSE victims. As a CSE victim I was ignored by the DWP. I was promised a Mental Health Nurse assessment and didn't see one. The general nurse didn't understand my issues. A paper-based assessment would protect victims from reliving trauma. 
Health Impacts of Child Sexual Exploitation - http://www.barnardos.org.uk/health_impacts_of_child_sexual_exploitation.pdf 

The Impact of CSE https://paceuk.info/about-cse/the-impact-of-child-sexual-exploitation/ 
Long Term Effects of CSE - https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/pdf/10.3109/01612848909140847

attributes.action: Make March 29th a public holiday from March 29th 2019
attributes.background: this is the day we officially leave the EU therefore it is only fitting that one of the most important days in modern history is marked as a national holiday.
attributes.additional_details:
Speaker John Bercow said the EU (Withdrawal) Bill, which repeals the 1972 European Communities Act through which Britain became a member of the bloc, had received royal assent from Queen Elizabeth II.

The bill transfers decades of European law onto British statute books, and also enshrines Brexit day in British law as March 29, 2019 at 11pm (2300 GMT) -- midnight Brussels time.

Prime Minister Theresa May said the approval was a "historic moment for our country, and a significant step towards delivering on the will of the British people".

attributes.action: Ban the sale of rat poison to prevent its misuse to protect other animals
attributes.background: There are frequent cases of the misuse of rat poison resulting in the poisoning of dogs, cats and other animals. There are other ways in which rats can be controlled so I would like to see the sale and use of Rat Poison banned.
attributes.additional_details: A simple search of the internet will find multiple cases.

attributes.action: Support the 'Campaign Against Nurdle Spills' to regulate nurdle handling
attributes.background: Nurdles are small plastic pellets used in the production of plastic products.  Due to poor handling and lack of regulation, nurdles have become a huge source of pollution to our oceans and waterways.  Visit https://cans.blog to see more.
attributes.additional_details: Once spilt into marine environments nurdles absorb toxic chemicals and pose an immediate danger to wildlife as their size makes them easily mistaken for food.  The 'Campaign Against Nurdle Spills' has written a piece of secondary legislation that specifies methods to regulate all nurdle handling in the UK and UK waters.  This legislation will force anyone handling over 2KG of nurdles to be registered and agree to the highest standards of care when handling nurdles.

attributes.action: Make housing associations subject to the freedom of information act.
attributes.background: I pay a service charge for property maintenance on my shared ownership property which is owned by a housing association. This service is contracted out to 3rd party. I recently asked for information relating to this arrangement and have been refused on the grounds that it is commercially sensitive.
attributes.additional_details: Bringing housing associations in line with the FOI act would mean that any requests for information relating to services that the residents wholly pay for, could not be refused outright and would be subject to intervention from the ICO.  This would enable more than 200,000 people to easily access information about their homes that they own in partnership with housing associations and therefore have more say in the running and the maintenance expenditure of their homes.

attributes.action: Stop paying tax on pensions
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, believe that paying tax on private and other pensions is unfair given that people would have paid tax on both their individual earnings and pension contributions.
attributes.additional_details:
We further believe that paying tax on private and other pensions unnecessarily penalises people who may have no other source of income after they retire.

We therefore call upon the British Government to immediately legislate to remove the requirement for people to pay tax on their pensions.
